page.title: 07LANTERN PIKE,PEAK DISTRICT
page.content: I was standing 970 feet above sea level.It was very windy and my papers were flying about.When I finally got everything sorted out,I started to write notes about what I could see from the top.I could see all of New Mills,Thornsett,and Rowarth.From this height New Mills looked like it had been built in a valley.We could not see Thornsett School.It was behind a hill.If I looked to the right I could see the path we walked on to get to the place that I was on.We were about 200 feet from the top point of Lantern Pike.The wind was so strong it took me about 15 minutes to get all my papers sorted out.Aspenshaw wood,which we had walked through earlier on,was straight ahead of me,so was wimberry wood.We could see clearly from here most of the fields were used for grazing.Only a few were cultivated.
